snippet: As a result of the Penn State scandal, lawmakers in many states are proposing rules that specify who would be required to report cases of child abuse or neglect.
abstract: Lawmakers in more than a dozen states, in the wake of Penn State child sex abuse scandal involving assistant coach Jerry Sandusky, have introduced bills adding coaches, athletic directors or university officials to the list of 'mandated reporters' of suspected child abuse or neglect.
lead_paragraph: As a result of the Penn State scandal, lawmakers in many states are proposing rules that specify who would be required to report cases of child abuse or neglect.

headline.seo: New Scrutiny on Coaches in Reporting Sexual Abuse
headline.main: Coaches Face New Scrutiny on Sex Abuse
headline.print_headline: After Penn State Case, Coaches Face New Scrutiny
